The Nobu children write cards to your address on Nobu Day, and the State has created a memorandum to honor you as a War Hero. Nobu’s on the street organize events to see your fleet battles live.

Your fanboy is relatively well-known within $theFaction, whether in person or by reputation. Most members of$theFaction  have joined together his achievements and yours, making you a hero in the eyes of the Nobu.

A young $theFaction officer has taken a liking to you, making modifications to his nobu cosplay to be closer to your image. It makes sure that patrol commanders are not sure whenever it is you or the fanboy.

The $faction Nobu have started talking about your value as a reliable asset, some of them are willing to give you some extra leeway on the loot distrbution.This shows mostly as low-grade surplus military equipment, and pinning your crimes on a rival Nobu.
You're not generally well known by $faction officials, for good or ill.

Though nothing has been proven (yet), $faction officials tend to view you with distrust. Link access to the port authority is granted only grudgingly, and you find yourself the subject of investigations and harassment frequently.

Suspicions have risen to an actionable level. Nobus sneer and joke at your expense, some of the more spiteful ones make hand-crafted piñatas with your face. $faction ports will be closed to your ilk, and patrols look to prevent your mischievious plans.

$Faction commanders have authorization to engage your fleet on sight, Nobu’s have an industrial line set up for the production of pots bearing a resemblence to your second’s ass and another for bats in image of the Emperor Sword.

You're relatively well-known within $theFaction, whether in person or by reputation. Most members of the Order will come to your aid, as a fellow spacer.
You have a benefactor in $theFaction, seeing how much you have done in their stead. Harassing you is therefore a more risky endeavor for local patrol commanders.

The $faction officials tend to view you favorably, though this has little in the way of implications. At best, you might be sold some low-grade surplus military equipment, or avoid being the target of an investigation if a more convenient scapegoat is available.
You're not generally well known by $faction officials, for good or ill.

Though nothing has been proven (yet), $faction officials tend to view you with distrust. Link access to the port authority is granted only grudgingly, and you find yourself the subject of investigations and harassment frequently.
Suspicions have risen to an actionable level. The Knights are keeping a good eye on you, $faction ports will be closed to your ilk, and patrols look to prevent your mischievious plans.

$Faction commanders have authorization to engage your fleet on sight, and all markets are prohibited from trading with you. The Knights have posted a caution phamplet for travelers with your face and name in bold red.
